results.title: Children of Bangkok
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Morris, Thanan Soongnarata and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
The film follows three Bangkok boys, from different economic classes through a typical day. One boy is the son of an Army colonel in the upper middle class, the second, the son of a middle-class shopkeeper and the third, the son of a lower class migrant farm worker. The film shows a cross section of life in Bangkok.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Morris, Thanan Soongnarata and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Chiang Mai: northern capital
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris, Thanom Soongnarata and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
In Chiang Mai, Thailand’s northern capital, many traditions and crafts have remained unchanged for hundreds of years. This film looks at the native handicrafts, including the production of silver jewellery, lacquerware utensils and silk-weaving. We take part in a colourful festival which marks the end of the Buddhist Lent. Through the day and into the night we see the solemn religious ceremonies, and the carefree carnival, complete with fireworks

results.title: Tenosinovitis
results.creator_credit: Women's Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Female sufferers of tenosynovitis describe how they became injured. They discuss the way that their injuries have affected their lives within the workforce and at home, where often they must perform all the domestic duties.
results.description: Female sufferers of tenosynovitis describe how they became injured. They discuss the way that their injuries have affected their lives within the workforce and at home, where often they must perform all the domestic duties.

results.title: Tennant Creek in passing
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film views Tennant Creek in the form of a passing glimpse, beginning with some long-shot filming of the natural environment and mines at sunrise in an approach to the town, focusing on buildings, inhabitants, passing vehicles and travellers, and completing the view with aerial shots moving away from Tennant Creek at sunset.

results.title: Tender is the night
results.brief_description: This lavish production of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s “Tender is the Night” is set against the sumptuous background of the playgrounds of Europe during the 1920s. Dick Diver, a brilliant young American psychiatrist, falls in love with Nicole Warren, a beautiful but schizophrenic American heiress. They make a stylish, glamorous couple and in the carnival atmosphere of the 1920s enjoy a lavish lifestyle on the French Riviera, in Paris and in Switzerland. This brings them a fascinating circle of friends, but rivalries and conflicting passions within the group strain their relationship and take a heavy toll on Nicole’s fragile health. For Dick, the intertwining of lives with Nicole ends in tragedy. Screenplay by Dennis Potter.

results.title: Ten days that shook the world = October = Oktyabr (TEFC) [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Grigori Alekandrov, Sergei Eisenstein and Sovkino of Moscow
results.brief_description: A historical re-enactment of the ten days in October 1918 when the Russian Kerensky regime was toppled by the Bolsheviks.

results.title: Childhood matters
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 26 of Series “Time to grow”.
In this final episode of the “Time to grow” series, issues are raised on child development and importantly on the question, “Does childhood matter?”. It summarises the other programs in the series and endeavours to give a complete overview of child development from infancy to adolescence.

results.title: Preschool social development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses developments such as emergence of a sense of morality, need for approval, gender identity, emotional regulation. Importance of adequate attachment experiences is stressed.

results.title: The typical twos
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Time to grow”.
Three case studies of two year-olds and their parents: Tyler, from a middle class family, Dominic, an American Indian, and Becky, from a low-income single parent family show the tensions between the needs for autonomy and attachment.

results.title: Getting along
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Time to grow”.
This program contains a discussion on the development of empathy, altruism and understanding of others in middle-childhood. It includes the effects of television, an interview of siblings of an autistic child and how to combat development of hostile or aggressive behaviour.
